articles.title: Latest Sonos Acquisition Suggests Headphone Launch Could Be Imminent
articles.content:
It looks like Sonos Inc (NASDAQ: SONO) may be trying to shake up the headset market after the company reportedly joined forces with a bluetooth audio software company developing next-gen products. 
What Happened: According to a Protocol report citing a Sonos spokesperson, Sonos acquired bluetooth audio startup T2 Software in November 2021. "Occasionally, we will acquire teams, talent, and/or technology that augment our existing and future product roadmap," the spokesperson told Protocol.
T2 Software has been working on rollouts of Bluetooth LE Audio and LC3 codec, which offers higher-quality ...

articles.title: If You Invested $1,000 In Each Of The FAANG Stocks One Year Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Now
articles.content:
Despite ongoing concerns about COVID-19, inflation, supply chain disruptions and rising interest rates, the Nasdaq is still trading more than 110% above its March 2020 lows.
Any tech investor during the past two years knows just how much of the recent growth in the tech sector is attributed to the five growth superstars of the Nasdaq: Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ: FB), Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL), Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN), Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: NFLX) and Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL).
These so-called FAANG stocks continue to deliver year-after-year of incredible growth numbers, even as their market caps swell to some of the largest in market history. While other companies were crushed by the pandemic, these FAANG stocks thrived in an environment of social distancing and remote working.
Related Link: If You Invested $1,000 In Tesla Stock One Year Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Now 
Tech Leadership Stumbles: Investors have done extremely well overall in the past year, but some stocks have certainly performed better ...
